discussion.content: It's personal view because customer service representatives cant create system views but they can create personal view via advanced find.
The answer is: "Create a personal view" and "Configure the group by on an editable grid", because the other available options require higher privileges (minimum system customizer security roles).
Given answers seems to be close
This Q was in exam
The second is more to it, but it´s not an Interactive dashboard, but a Dynamics Dashboard. Group by has nothing to do with multiple lista at all.

Answer is correct. 
I personally verified by trying this with CSR role on trial environment.
1. CSR can create Personal Views from Advances Find.
2. CSR can create Dynamics D365 Dashboard and can show multiple multiple lists on single screen in that Dashboard.

How can we view multiple lists on a single screen with editable grid? Editable Grid displays a view where you can sort, filter, group, modify records but to show multiple lists like a list of resolved cases, a list of active cases, a list of cancelled cases on a single screen? Definitely not. That should be done with an interactive experience dashboard and it can be personal.
Interactive dashboards cannot be personal dashboards.
To create an interactive dashboard needs needs admin privileges as such wouldn't it be group by on the editable grid?
is the given answer correct? seems like from Mokrane's thread it is?

comments.content: also, the prompt says that you need to do this for yourself, not for all the organization.
customer service representatives don't have permissions to create views at all with default configuration, what they have though is saved views at the user level. Maybe it's because of that.

discussion.content: i didn't understand why it should be a personal view

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You are a customer service representative working with cases in Dynamics 365 for Customer Service.
You need to manage multiple lists of cases.
Which actions should you perform? To answer, select the appropriate configuration in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are configuring a business process flow for a case entity.
All cases must be flagged for review.
You need to complete configuration of the business process flow.
Solution: For a new action named Ready for review, disable the As a business process flow action step option.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: "As a Business Process flow action step" check box should be checked.

Selected Answer: B
No; the answer is B
Answer is NO

Action which we want to trigger from BPF, must be allowed to run as a business process flow. 
i.e. "As a Business Process flow action step" check box should be checked.
No. If Ready for review action steps is going to configure in the business process flow setup, the business flow step option will need to be enabled.
If Ready for review action steps is going to configure in the business process flow setup, the As a business flow step option need to be enabled. Answer B. NO
"You are configuring a business process flow for a case entity." disabling a BPF does not relate to configuring it for a case

questions.question_text:
You manage Dynamics 365 for Customer Service.
You need to configure automatic case creation for emails received by customers who have a support contract.
What should you do?

choices.D: Create an automatic record creation and update rule. Set the source type to email. If a valid entitlement exists, configure the rule to create a case.
choices.A: Configure service level agreements to be on hold until a call can be made to the customer.
choices.B: Create an automatic record creation and update rule. Set the source type to email. Configure the rule to send automatic email responses to customers when records are created.
choices.C: Create an automatic record creation and update rule. Set the source type to service activity. Configure the rule to send automatic email responses to customers when records are created.

discussion.content: Correction must be D

comments.content: also "automatic case creation" instead of automatic email response
D - because question says "...customers who have a support contract"

discussion.content: Correction must be D
Correct must be D

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Correct Answer is D
In Settings > Service Management> Automatic Case Creation Rules> New Record Creation and Update Rule > SPECIFY CONDITIONS FOR RECORD CREATION > Create case if a valid entitlement exists for the customer 
You must select "Create case if a valid entitlement exists for the customer" to Yes to check for customers who have a support contract.
D is correct

comments.content: its D bro. The other ones dont make any sense

discussion.content: Should be B, https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/automatically-create-case-from-email#create-cases-automatically-using-rules

I don't really agree with this answer. Since the phone call activity is logged within the case, there is no reason to change the regarding as it is automatically asssociated with the case you are working with. On the other hand, the recommended answer says, "Change" implying that the call you are logging has the wrong associated record. 

Simply, create the Phone Call Activity from within the case, Add a Subject, Phone Number and descrption and you're done.
Agree with Dude, 2,4,1

comments.content:
i also agree with that.
When you create phone call directly from within the case, there is no need to change the regarding because the regarding automatically will be set to the originating case.
"Enter a subject" is correct because in an uncustomized system the subject is required. You can't create a phone call without subject.

discussion.content:
only q3 should be: enter a subject
rest is correct
Agree to 2 4 1.
Correct answer is 2 4 1

correct answer is 
2 – Select an existing record
4 –Select Add Phone Call Activity
1 – Enter a subject (it is mandatory field)

There are two ways to associate a phone call to a case record:
1. Select the case record > Timeline > Add a phone call activity > Add subject.
2. Activity > Add a phone call > Regard: Add a case record > Add subject.
This question was on the exam.

I don't agrre either:
- I slect the case
- create the activity
- fill in the subject for the phone call activity

It is also not good practice (in B2B environments at least) to link other records to a contact. Answer is 2,4,1.
5 is garbage - the question tells you it is an existing case

The answer is 2-4-1. 
Why would you change the regarding field to contact when its already linked to the case?
Should be 2 - 4 - 1.
Agree With 241

Agree with Dude, via this link you can find the answer, it clearly says the contact is automatically populated.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/user-guide-customer-service

“ Add a phone call

Open the record you want to add the activity to.
If you do not see the Add Phone Call area open in the middle of the page, select Activities > Add Phone Call.
In the Description area, provide a summary of the conversation with the customer. You must fill in this area before you can save the phone call.
The Call With field is automatically populated with the customer name you select in the account or contact field. You can select a different contact, account, lead, or user record if required.”

2,4,1 
Also, changing Regarding contradicts the requirement to display in Case timeline. If you change that value the Phone activity will get associated with a different record, and not showing on the case timeline.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You make a phone call regarding an existing case record.
You need to create a phone call activity that appears on the case record timeline.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.E: In Solution Explorer, select the Root Cause Analysis entity and then select Knowledge management.
choices.B: Add a lookup to the article entity.
choices.C: In Solution Explorer, expand the Root Cause Analysis entity and select Forms. Edit the main form and configure a knowledge base search control.
choices.A: Navigate to the Knowledge Base Management Settings wizard. Then, navigate to Record types and select Root Cause Analysis.
choices.D: In Solution Explorer, expand the Root Cause Analysis entity and select Forms. Edit the main form and configure a subgrid for knowledge articles.

discussion.content:
ACE

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/add-knowledge-base-search-control-forms
It is a new custom Entity it should be enabled for knowledge Management, So response E should be in. ACE is correct

for A: There is no explicit mention of a "Root Cause Analysis" entity in the Dynamics 365 default knowledge management configuration. The Knowledge Base Management Settings wizard typically deals with entities like Case, Article, and other standard entities, not custom entities. and for 
The configuration for custom entities, such as adding a lookup to the article entity, is typically done through customization tools and forms rather than through the Knowledge Base Management Settings wizard.
BCD according to Chat gpt
I think the correct answer is CDE, because option E contains A and A is depricated
ACD for sure. Tested. Option E is not necessary in included in A
This Q was in exam

The Answers should be :
A / C / D / E

> There's 2 ways to display the knowledge base article from a form :
 - Insert "Knowledge base search control" (answer C)
 OR
 - Insert "Subgrid" and choose "Knowledge Base Article" as Entity on Data source section (answer D)

> Answer E is a prerequisites to enable Knowledge Article from the entity

Correct. 
Step 1: When you create an entity, you need to define if you want the entity to use Knowledge Article for resolutions by checking on Knowledge Management option.
Step 2: When your entity is available for knowledge management, you need to enable to ability of searching through Knowledge Base by adding the entity in Embedded Knowledge Base Search.
Step 3: The previous steps are to create a "soul" for your entity. Now you need to create a "body" by adding a knowledge base search control to the main form.

I don't agree with selection E. Whilst you can select Knowledge Management when creating an entity, it is greyed on existing entities. Therefore, selecting an entity in the solution and checking Knowledge Management is not a valid action to carry out.

ACE is correct and this is why: You can configure knowledge management for an entity either via the wizard in service settings OR in solution explorer by selecting the entity and checking the box. However, you do not need to add a subgrid for knowledge articles for your form, which makes D incorrect. Adding the knowledge base search control is enough for users to search, read, and rate articles. I just verified all this in Dynamics.
ACD is correct E is not required.

Answer provided ACE is correct.

step E is all about enabling the knowledge management setting for an entity. Actually, this is the first step. by order > EAC or ECA

ACE is correct
The order is E >> A >> C
ACE is correct answer as you dont need subgrid for KB records, Just control on form to link and find relevant article as per the requirement

I strongly think this is ACD. enabling KB for an existing custom entity is greyed out on the entity options. But you can go through KB management settings and select which entities you want KB enabled. In conclusion, when you take action for step A, you dont need to go into the entity and enable KB usage.

comments.content: And to link articles to a case, you can add a subgrid to the case and select which articles are related. So D must be in.

discussion.content: Correct Answer
Correct Answer ACE
I agree with Arshad

comments.content: is seems like a lot people are saying ACE maybe arshad was wrong?

discussion.content: It should be ACD as E is not required as it's auto-selected when we enable Knowledge Management Setting for entity.

comments.content:
I believe this is correct as well. why?

I think the correct answer is A,B,C. Why?

Use A rather than E for an existing custom entity. Why? If you look at the checkbox for the entity in solution explorer, you'll see it's greyed out and uncheckable. This CRM Tip of the Day addresses that and says to use A: https://crmtipoftheday.com/732/knowledge-management-is-disabled-for-custom-entities/

D is needed as it says users need to be able to link articles. Articles in the plural, so not B. C will allowing linking article*s*.

And of course B for searching articles.

Agreed: A, C, D
It's not E for sure. Step A, fulfills step E too.
My apologies, bad copy and paste after i changed my mind. The second sentence above is totally wrong. Please ignore it. The answer is A, C, D

questions.question_text:
A customer service organization plans to implement knowledge management for a custom entity named Root Cause Analysis.
Users must be able to search, link, and rate knowledge articles. Users must be provided with suggested knowledge articles.
You need to configure Dynamics 365 for Customer Service.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
